title.narrative: EC Instrument for PreAccession Assistance (IPA) Sarajevo Waste Water Treatment Plant (Butila) Single Donor Trust Fund

description.narrative:
The Project Development Objective (PDO) of SWWP is to improve the living conditions of populations in the areas covered by the Sarajevo Water and Waste Water Company and in downstream riverside communities by: (a) reducing the populations’ exposure to, and reliance on highly polluted water from the Miljacka and Bosna River; and (b) improving the efficiency of the waste water collection network in the Sarajevo Canton. The project aims to achieve this objective through financing investments in the rehabilitation of the Sarajevo WWTP and sewerage network in the Sarajevo Canton. The main Outcome Indicators include:
1. Reduction in river pollution measured by amount of BOD5 removed at the WWTP (number) 2. Volume of waste water collected treated (m3/day) 3. Number of sewer connections benefiting from rehabilitation works (48,000) 4. Number of sewer blockages per year (2900 or 13% decrease)
And the project consists of the following components: Component A - High Priority Infrastructure Rehabilitation I. repair and replacement of primary and secondary sewers in Sarajevo; and II. rehabilitation of Sarajevo’s WWTP. Component B - Institutional Development Support I. institutional strengthening for improving financial management capacity and operational efficiency to enhance long-term financial viability; and II. support the preparation of feasibility studies, technical designs, and other technical studies for follow-up investments in water and waste rehabilitation. Component C - Project management.
The proposed AF is intended to support construction works at the WWTP, including a wastewater boiler room and related facilities, which would enable the completion of the sludge treatment process. It is thus expected to directly contribute to the achievement of PDO indicators 1 and 2.
Incoming Commitment(Cumulative Signed Contribution)-as of June 30th, 2020
